page.title: 18VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: In common with other primary schools, Tackley and Wootton Schools face the problem of{falling rolls} and the likelihood of losing teachers and there fore fewer classes in 1987. The hours allowed for cleaning and cooking mid-day meals have been cut. The Schools are in good heart,the children learning from first hand experience. They learn to organise their own work. {Small schools} are threatened with closure; big schools are cheaper to run, have better facilities and specialist staff. Yet here we have close support from parents; staff tailor work to suit the individual child while the atmosphere of the school is friendlier and less formal than in a large school.
